title: Songkran: Thailand's Water Fight
description: A short lesson to help you apply Songkran: Thailand's Water Fight.

hook.text: Every April, Thailand turns into a nationwide water fight. Nobody â€” not even tourists â€” stays dry.

buildup.text: Songkran marks Thai New Year. Water symbolizes cleansing, renewal, and washing away the past year.

discovery.text: Originally, Thais gently poured scented water over elders' hands as a sign of respect.

twist.text: It evolved into an all-out battle. Super soakers, hoses, and trucks with water tanks fill the streets.

climax.text: Bangkok's Khao San Road becomes the epicenter. Tourists fly in just for the three-day celebration.

punchline.text: A gentle blessing became the world's largest water fight.

quiz.question: What does water symbolize during Songkran?
